thread.title: Portland ends West Creek's volleyball season in region
thread.title_full: Portland ends West Creek's volleyball season in region

title: Portland ends West Creek's volleyball season in region
text:
Portland ends West Creek's volleyball season in region Craig Harris, Gannett Tennessee 7:11 p.m. CDT October 14, 2015 West Creek High junior Chloe Clifton passes a serve during the first game of the Region 5-AAA volleyball tournament Tuesday in Portland. (Photo: Craig Harris / Gannett Tennessee) CONNECT 1 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
HENDERSONVILLE, Tenn. — The West Creek High School volleyball team ended its season with a 25-16, 25-15, 26-24 loss to Portland in the Region 5-AAA Tournament semifinal round, which was played on Tuesday afternoon at Portland High School. 
It was the third consecutive regional appearance for the Lady Coyotes, who fell to Portland in the 2013 semifinals and to Beech in the semifinal round a year ago. 
“Maybe it’s my fault for overpracticing on stopping Abby (Akins, the Lady Panthers’ senior outside hitter),” West Creek head coach Josh Stoeckl said. “Sometimes, you can overpractice something. We knew they were going to be a fight. They’re a quality team, and she’s an outstanding player.” 
The Lady Coyotes never led in the first two games as they struggled to pass Portland’s serves. 
“We’ve struggled with serve-receive most of the year with a team that’s really aggressive,” Stoeckl said. 
However, West Creek (21-19) led for most of the third game as senior setter Samantha Nieves served her squad out to a 4-1 lead. 
The Lady Coyotes extended the advantage to 13-8, then 17-11 and to 19-12 when the Lady Panthers were whistled for double contact. 
However, after a sideout, Akins served up six consecutive points to tie the third game at 19. 
West Creek — which has won the last two District 10-AAA Tournament titles — had a game point, but Portland freshman Marlayna Bullington produced a kill to tie it at 24. 
Then, an Akins kill and a service winner by Bullington ended the match. 
The Lady Coyotes lose five seniors — Nieves, Sydney Caldwell, Mercedes Nicholson, Azriya Smith and Tawnie Smith Southern. 
Portland (31-7) — which won the District 9-AAA regular-season championship before suffering a five-game loss to Beech in the 9-AAA Tournament final — advanced to face the winner of the Beech-Springfield semifinal match in Tuesday evening’s championship match. With the semifinal win, the Lady Panthers earned a spot in their 13th sectional/substate match and third consecutive sectional. 
West Creek’s Mercedes Nicholson was named to the All Region Team. Read or Share this story: http://leafne.ws/1RIWl3f TOP VIDEOS
